sentences.sContent: They wrote various numbers on a large sheet of paper.
sentences.sCn: 他们在一张大纸上写下了很多不同的数字。

sentences.sContent: ...despite an increase in the UK population and a subsequent rise in the number of households...
...When you can quote a specific number like a fifth of the patients were able to quit...
...A very small number of people are able to remember almost every detail of their life...
...There has been an increase in the number of travelers since the installation of the cable cars in 1990s...
...the agency says projections of the number of unemployed people this year range from 210 million to nearly 240 million people...
...Researchers from the University of Connecticut Health Center asked the residents a large number of questions about their quality of life...
...The International Labor Organization says the number of people without jobs is increasing...
...These make alcohol less easy to get and reduce the number of psychological cues to drink...
...The world is facing an astonishing rise in the number of old people...

synos.tran: [数]数；（杂志等的）期；号码；数字；算术
编号；计入；数…的数目；使为数有限

phrases.pCn: adv. 合计数为...；达到...的数目

trans.tranOther: a word or sign that represents an amount or a quantity
